stream_context.summary: Kaze programs and tests a new oil-themed enemy ("Fizz Oil") and polishes an underground drill/oil-rig section while mentioning that Course 4 and the zoo area are now fixed and about to enter beta-testing.

development_findings.summary: Course 4 was fully repaired off-stream and is being sent to external beta testers soon.
development_findings.quote: I finished fixing up course four so it's ready for beta testing; we're gonna send it off to be tested soon.

development_findings.summary: The zoo sub-area is functional again after broad fixes; the only remaining task is receiving new animations from Zeina.
development_findings.quote: All we're waiting now is for a few animations that Zeina's making and after that course 4 is once again functional.

development_findings.summary: A brand-new enemy, "Fizz Oil," was conceived and implemented: it slides around, turns into a puddle when it sees Mario, makes the ground slippery, and can be killed with soap to drop two coins.
development_findings.quote: This is going to slime around and then when it sees Mario it's going to go whoop and turn into a puddle… hitting them with soap just kills them.

development_findings.summary: Fizz Oil’s slipperiness is achieved by dynamically modifying the surface triangle Mario is standing on, avoiding any core engine edits for performance reasons.
development_findings.quote: We need to somehow externally do this… When Mario is overlapping this we store the triangle and just dynamically edit the triangle.

development_findings.summary: Several visual assets were updated: new low-poly drill models, oil clouds (planned), boiling-oil effect (planned), and improved Chain Chomp and ball models with better eyes.
development_findings.quote: The chain chomp is so much nicer looking now and the ball too… I think that works as a drill kinda.

development_findings.summary: Star-select scenes must depict Mario traveling to a level; any concept that breaks that rule is rejected to preserve cohesion.
development_findings.quote: The idea with the star selects is that it shows Mario traveling to the level so… it would just break the concept.

development_findings.summary: Switching to hashed geometry lists allows model IDs up to 0x60, greatly expanding scene complexity.
development_findings.quote: Now we have hashing tables instead of normal geo layouts… we can actually have up to model ID 0x60, which is insane.

development_findings.summary: Fast64, the primary level editor, is open-source; rendering bugs persist and Kaze wishes more people contributed fixes.
development_findings.quote: Fast 64 is open source and people are working on fixing the program up although I wish there were more people working on Fast 64.

development_findings.summary: Performance micro-optimisations (e.g., avoiding extra engine calls and cache misses) are still a design priority, even at microsecond scale.
development_findings.quote: Yes, 4 microseconds is a lot in my world.

development_findings.summary: Kaze intends to open-source the entire engine once the project is complete so others can maintain and build on it.
development_findings.quote: This is guaranteed open source; I want people to be able to maintain this code base after I leave the scene.

context_findings.summary: Kaze received a phone call from Zeina’s father about house-related information, indicating real-life obligations.
context_findings.quote: That was Zeina's dad; he just needed some info about the house.

context_findings.summary: He streams from his basement and jokes about being ‘banished’ there, hinting at personal living arrangements.
context_findings.quote: Yes, this is just my basement… This is where I've been banished to.

context_findings.summary: Financial responsibility for his family influences project choices; a brand-new commercial N64 game is not viable for him right now.
context_findings.quote: I wish I could [make a brand-new N64 game] but it's not financially viable… I do have a family now that I need to provide for.

context_findings.summary: Long-term, he plans to open-source the engine for community longevity.
context_findings.quote: I want other people to be able to make hacks off of my engine.

context_findings.summary: He balances excitement ("this looks so good") and frustration with bugs, displaying open emotional swings during development.

biobak.summary: Biobak provides feedback on polygon budgets and would ‘cuss him out’ for excess triangles.
biobak.quote: There are some polygons I can remove here… before Biobak cusses me out.

zeina.summary: Zeina is creating new animations for the zoo area; their completion gates Course 4 testing.
zeina.quote: All we're waiting now is for a few animations that Zeina's making.

key_stories.title: Rescuing Course 4 and the Zoo
key_stories.summary: Earlier revisions broke assets in Course 4, especially the zoo. Kaze spent off-stream time repairing geometry and logic while Zeina produces fresh animations. The level is now ready for external beta testing.
key_stories.challenge: Legacy levels broke due to ongoing development, leaving Course 4 unplayable.
key_stories.process: Kaze debugged and fixed geometry; Zeina builds replacement animations.
key_stories.outcome: Course 4 is ‘once again functional’ and queued for beta testing.
key_stories.key_quote: Whenever we work we're breaking a bunch of old levels so I'm going through them all again and fixing them.

key_stories.title: Creating the Fizz Oil Enemy
key_stories.summary: Kaze designed an oil variant of the Fizzlit enemy to match the drill/oil-rig theme. He modeled, animated, and programmed it in one session, inventing a slippery-floor mechanic without touching core engine code.
key_stories.challenge: Need for a thematic, low-poly oil enemy that affects gameplay without heavy engine edits.
key_stories.process: Modeled in Fast64, wrote custom texture animation, dynamically altered surface physics, iterated on scale and particles, and integrated soap interaction.
key_stories.outcome: Working Fizz Oil enemy that can be killed with soap and subtly alters platforming difficulty.
key_stories.key_quote: They're here for the vibes; as soon as he comes, it gets slippery.
